title: The Big Two? This Alcaraz-Sinner rivalry is epic
description: Sinner and Alcaraz have combined to win the last six Grand Slams -- and are pushing each other to new heights in the sport.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: WTA, Tennis Channel reach 6-year rights deal
description: The women's professional tennis tour and Tennis Channel announced Wednesday they have a six-year rights deal.

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let’s take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: Murray wants to shield kids from 'damaging' social media
description: Sir Andy Murray says he is trying to protect his children from "damaging" social media platforms as he supports more action following Katie Boulter's BBC interview.

title: Raducanu must 'get head in the game' before Wimbledon
description: British number one Emma Raducanu succumbs to defeat by teenager Maya Joint in an edgy second-round match at Eastbourne.

title: Sinner's serve sparks fire... literally!
description: Jannik Sinner can turn up the heat on serve. The World No. 1 in the PIF ATP Rankings literally did so in a jaw-dropping video, showing off his fiery precision and blazing firepower to light a match standing upright in the grass. The blazing stunt has quickly caught fire on Instagram. As of 6 p.m. ET on Wednesday, the video has generated more than six million views, sparking debate over whether it is pure skill or clever and hilarious editing. Either way, it makes for must-watch viewing. View this post on Instagram A post shared by ATP Tour (@atptour) Sinner is the top seed at Wimbledon, where main-draw action begins Monday, 30 June. The 23-year-old will be seeking his fourth major crown and first at the grass-court tournament. He arrives at the All England Club with a 19-3 season record, according to the Infosys ATP Win/Loss Index. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Fritz & Fonseca showdown suspended due to darkness
description: Taylor Fritz and Joao Fonseca will have a nervy night of sleep at the Lexus Eastbourne Open, where their second-round clash was suspended due to darkness after they split sets. The top-seeded American raced through the opener 6-3 in just 26 minutes, but Fonseca dug deep to claim the second set 7-6(5). The match will resume Thursday not before 12 p.m. local time. Fritz was just two points from victory at 5/5 in the second-set tie-break, yet the 18-year-old Brazilian made a clutch volley at his shoelaces to earn a set point, which he converted to force a decider. The winner between Fritz and Fonseca will return to court later on Thursday and face American Marcos Giron in the quarter-finals. Fritz won the ATP 250 in Stuttgart two weeks ago and is 21-11 on the season, according to the Infosys ATP Win/Loss Index. Fonseca, tied at his career-high No. 57 in the PIF ATP Rankings, is aiming for his maiden Top 5 win in his first Lexus ATP Head2Head meeting with Fritz. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Alcaraz Saves 3 Championships Points to Defend Roland Garros Title
description: Carlos Alcaraz clinched his fifth Grand Slam title in a thrilling five-set battle against Jannik Sinner at Roland Garros on Sunday, rallying from two sets down to win 4-6, 6-7(4), 6-4, 7-6(3), 7-6(10-2). The match, the longest Roland Garros final ever at 5 hours and 29 minutes, saw Alcaraz save three championship points in the …
author: Jonathan

title: French Open 2025 Semi Final Recap
description: Day Thirteen at Roland Garros delivered two very different semi-finals, but one clear outcome: the dream final is on. Carlos Alcaraz was the first to book his spot, recovering from a slow start to take control against Lorenzo Musetti, who was forced to retire early in the fourth set due to a leg injury. The …
author: Jonathan
